text: The body has a deep old copper/amber color. It is very hazy and it produces a small creamy, light tan colored head on top. The head slowly fades down to a thin ring of foam that makes a little slice lacing on the glass. Its aroma has big full nose of fruity and bready yeast with notes of banana, clove, toffee and fruited liquor. To start with this beer has a nice mellow warmth throughout from its 8%abv. It has a big fruity yeast character and full bready malt with plenty of sweetness up front. It has notes of ripe banana, golden raison, sour cherry and just a hint of toffee, clove and leafy hops. The hops add some light bitterness to the back end. The finish is bone dry and the palate is very smooth with a solid medium to full body.

Rated on 5-30-2009 at Fort Wayne, IN Gathering (Bottle) This beer pours a small head, hazy orange body, no lacing, and very little carbonation. The Aroma is banana, spicy and caramel. The Taste is semi-fruity, clove, spicy, and banana. The Palate is tingly and this beer is medium bodied. Overall, the clove and banana flavor dominate this beer and a bit too much. A tasty beer and a beer that I recommend trying.

a: light straw yellow color, cloudy unfiltered, 1/2" head that reduce to lacing

s: banana and clove

t: banana dominates the flavor, spices and malt. The achohol does come through, but only a little

m&d: a medium body, easy to drink despite it slightly higher ABV.

Excellent

12 oz bottle from my want list from Doodler!!! Nose is a mix of light butterscotch and banana with some cloves mixed in. Cloudy plum red with a very light beige head. Flavor is a toffeeish, fruity mix with a bit of alcohol.
older bottle, first batch? orangish pour. banana cloveiness, in aroma & flavor. spicy notes, shows its 8%. enjoyable beer
Pours an orange-like amber with a white head. Great tastes of bananas with a little doughy palette. Nice medium body. Terrific for its style. Probably my favorite Great Lakes beer to date.

12 ounce bottle into weizen glass, best by 11/28/09.  Pours very hazy and cloudy reddish orange color with a small foamy 1 finger off white head with decent retention that reduces to a ring of lace pretty quickly.  No glass lacing.  Aromas of big caramel covered bananas, biscuit, molasses, light orange zest, spices, and a bit of alcohol to round it out.  Some excellent aromas here, very inviting.  Taste of big banana, caramel, pepper, biscuit, clove, and molasses.  No bitterness on the finish; but there is some lingering notes of caramel, banana, bread, molasses, and spices on the finish for a bit.  Medium carbonation and body; with a very nice creamy and smooth mouthfeel that drinks easily.  No alcohol noticed other than a slight warming after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent and delicious Weizenbock at almost 2 years past freshness date.  I wonder if they will ever bottle it again.

12oz bottle.  Hazy golden in color with a small white head.  Typical wheaty aroma, good intensity, with orange and banana.  The flavor has wheat, sweet malt, orange peel, banana, and spices.  Medium-bodied with average carbonation.  A pretty nice weizenbock - definitely on the upper end of the style.

$3.30 single bottle from Binnys "best by" Nov 09. Hey, I figured this could lay down for a while. This pours a big malty smell and, Ill admit, a bit of medicinal phenol from age. Deep brown in appearance, though not opaque or cloudy. Forget about sustaining any kind of head. But very malty and sticky. In a beer this aged, the weizen esters are long gone, leaving a plum impression, but then theres a tiny bit of banana in the burp-back. A bit of sherry in there as well, but still pretty sweet. So this is yet a very good aged beer, worth holding onto until now.

Poured hazy orange-ish yellow with white head, aroma picked up nice notes of biscuit, honey, spicy clove, banana, some other slight fruity esters with a touch of toasted bread as well.  Taste is some slight roasted malt, nice rich clove and banana leading into a hint of biscuit and toffee, finishing fairly dry but a bit sweet.
Tap at brewery.  hazy amber color with a small white head. Sweet fruity aroma and tasted of banana, cloves and some honey? Creamy palate.overall excellent

Phone rate. Draught at brewpub. Finally get to rate this after a few years of wanting it. Cloudy auburn brown with a one finger light beige, fading to a thin ring after a minute or two. Toasty malts and molasses dominate, the yeasty banana is actually lurking behind with a bit of brown sugar. Banana is a little stronger in the flavor, alcohol is present. Still toasty, has less molasses. A little sweet for my taste, low bitterness. Low carbonation with a big thick body. Not bad, but I feel (at least this batch) is a little overrated by the style.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Gabf. Cloudy yellow orange appearance- a little light for a weizen bock- white head. Spicy yeasty, banana, clove, toasty wheat malty aroma. Toasty, dark wheat, banana, clove flavor. Pretty nice brew.

12 oz bottle.  Best by 11/28/09 (oops).  This pours orange amber with an off-white head and lots of fine suspended particles.  Sweet candy aroma, caramelly and fruity: Im actually reminded a bit of my couple experiences with sake due to the candy perception.  Flavor is again quite candy-like, caramel, apple, clove.  I can tell its been in the bottle for a while, and it seems like its probably thinned out some, but the flavor is still quite nice.  Would definitely like to try a fresher bottle.

Hazy deep orange colour, mediumsized big slightly off-white foamy head, that leaves some lace. Aroma is sweet toffee, wheat, mild spices as well as banana and some mild yeastyness. Flavour is rather similar along with some alcoholic sweetness. Mild nuttyness as well.
Pours a hazy amber with a lasting, white head.  Smells of bubblegum, clove, bananas, coriander.  Tastes sweet and spicy with some clove and bananas on the finish.

t pours a medium amber with not much of a head and what is there is gone quickly. The lacing is very watery as is the beer, nothing special.

The aroma is light banana with wheat.

The taste is light and sweet with a hint of hops, nothing special to keep you having more than one but it is drinkable. Mouthfeel is light.

12-oz bottle Wineworks, Springfield, OH - aroma:bread, clove, raisins, vanilla, banana; appearance: clear with sediment, amber color, no head or laces;  Flavor: sweet, salty, spicy, malty; Mouthfeel: medium-full bodied, thick texture, soft carbonation: Overall: a nice strong, fruity, spicy, and malty wheat beer.  Unfortunately, the bottle was a little old and the sediment didnt mix into the beer very well but very clumpy.

Whoaa!  Time is lost!!  Break out the Glockenspiel....for no apparent reason......get it OUT! The in-laws are waiting!  Let them drink this.  Save the Blatz for yourself.  Youll thank me in the morning.

(bottle, from trade w/ blutt59). Dark copper color, with light cloudiness. Medium off white head, which is mostly diminishing.  Moderate caramel aroma, with light alcohol and light wheat. Moderate caramel, dark fruit, and alcohol flavor. Avg duration. Light alcohol finish. Thin/slick texture. Soft carbonation. Spare lacing.

Weizen Bock has quickly grown on me as a style.  The intense flavor and the awesome aroma really hits home.  Of the ones I have tried Glockenspiel is one of my favorites.  The beer pours a beautiful darkish red/brown.  Right away the aromas of clove are noticeable.  

The beer drinks quite easy for 8% (always scared when I say that).

Pours a clear copper color with no head. Nice aroma of bananas, caramel and candy. Good flavor of bananas, caramel and candy, the sweetness lingers for a while. The body is light to medium with an oily texture and soft carbonation.

Hazy reddish brown - thick, frothy lace - doughy, yeasty nose, with notes of cloves and overripe pears and apples - mildly acidic kick starts the flavor, followed by some wheaty tang, but overall, the flavor is quite sweet for most of the experience - especially in the finish, where it becomes a bit much - a lot of overripe apple in the flavor - mid to low levels of yeast phenols in the form of clove and bubblegum - finishes with a little brown sugar - quite good, but the sweetness is a little too much.

2010 Bottle - Thanks inflatablehair!!! - Pours a clear honey orange with a small beige ring of head...aroma is nicely fruity and malty, banana, pear, apple, spice and honey...flavour is similar, all the fruitiness follows thru, with some dry grain, clove...finish is a bit thin, but overall very nice...

MMMmmm, nice brew. Poured aggresively and got an ok tan head that quickly subsided with no lace. Color is a hazy copper. Aroma is a Bavarian hefeweizen with loads of malt. Flavor is like aroma with lots of caramel and some toffee. Great body and carbonation. Finish is a bit sweet but decent.

Pours an orange/amber with an off-white head. Nose is some light cloves and bananas, touch of dark caramel, dark fruits and a hint of wheat. Finishes dry, malty, wheat, caramel. Very tasty, easy to drink. Not showing the ABV.

From bottle. Nice sweet aroma, with neutral fruity character, brown sugar, and Twizzlers. Light hops, but very mild. Coppery amber clear with thin off-white creamy head. Medium watery body with medium-high carbonation. Starts a bit sweet, with light caramel, some Twizzlers, neutral fruit, and carbonic acidity. Light bitterness in the finish, nutty. A bit of extra sugar tang. Light alcohol notes. Clean finish and after, though a touch of solvent.
9th October 2008. Hazy amber beer - full of banana and cloves. Dry and crisp. Not a bad take on the style but where is that US innovation?
This was tasty.  Hazy orange amber color.  Wheat, banana, and solid bock malts in the aroma.  A very smooth taste with no bite from the wheat.

Picked up a single 12-oz bottle at Three Cellars in Franklin, WI. Pours a semi-hazy copper amber colored brew with a thick off-white head that really sticks around. Aroma of golden grain malt, dark pitted fruits, banana esters, a hint of caramel and some clove. Taste is full bodied, smooth with flavors of roasted golden grain malt, banana, clove with a hint of cotton candy and candi sugar. Finish is slightly oily, semi-dry with a nice alcohol warmth. Very solid and very well done.

Deep amber color out of the bottle with a modest off white head.  Light banana clove nose with honey syrup, candy floss and burnt caramel in the nose.  Puffed wheat taste (like the Super Sugar Crisp cereal of my youth), caramel corn, banana, clove spice, and some fruity flavors as it warms.  This is a really nice beer that I have enjoyed while its been abailable.  It will be missed.

Glorious stuff right here... Pours a little bit darker copper color than is pictured... Nice estery, banana and malt aroma... Flavor brings out the weizen yeast, but also has a caramelly/ chocolately flavor to it. You wouldnt know the alcohol is as high as it is until youve had a few, cuz you certainly cant taste it in the beer. So far every beer ive tried from great lakes has been stellar, and theyve nailed the style

In short: A glass of juicy caramelized cereals without much character.  Nothing bad, nothing very good.
How: Bottle 12oz.  Mini-tasting session with some of the Montreal crew.
The look: Partly cloudy golden copper body topped by an off-white ring of foam
In long: Light but pleasant nose of fruit juice and cereals.  Taste is smooth, body is lean, carbonation is low.  A bit lifeless.  Juicy sensation (like cereal juice), some caramel, distant bananas.  Some leafy hops without much bite.  All in all this was a very drinkable brew but also a very ordinary one.  Not impressive.  Named after a magical device that enables anybody to become a professional musician.

See thru copper with an ultra fast dissipating tan head.  Aroma of fruit, grains, toasted malt, toffee, banana and clove.  Taste of banana, clove, spice, toasted malt, dark fruit, light nutmeg and alcohol.  Somewhat oily mouth feel and a dry finish.

Bottle pours a clear copper body with a medium beige head. Sparse wispy lacing. Aroma of spicy hops, clove, ripe banana, and crushed white pepper. Medium body is thinner than expected. Well carbonated. Taste mirrors aroma. Toffee, caramel, ripe banana, a green apple note, hints of clove and pepper. Lacks the depth of better examples of the style, but well made and enjoyable.

12 oz bottle.  Deep orange brown with a thin beige haze.  Nose is caramel, wheat and raisin with a touch of spice.  Medium body with sharp fizzy carb.  Taste is banana, burnt sugar and yeasty wheat.  Some clove in the finish.

Thanks to Lou (bluesandbarbq) who sent me this, bottle 4 of our 4 for 4 swap.  Im always down with trying a new Great Lakes product, so this was easy to enjoy.  The beer pours out a golden orange color, slightly cloudy with a 2" off-white frothy head.  Lots of fruitiness in the aroma, toasted malts, bananas, cloves and caramel all meld together incredibly well.  Flavor has some nice sweetness to it with and orange and banana 1-2 punch.  Some light clove notes, a subtle doughy character that finishes with a touch of honey.  Really nice.  Just wish it were available in California.

Bottle [12oz]. Pours a slightly hazy, very deep amber with a small diminishing frothy off-white head. Mild aroma of light caramel malt, light fruit and light spices -- its all very light. Flavour of caramel malt, light fruit, light spices and a light bitter finish. Light to average bodied. Not bad but its all very mild and a bit dull. Still, its easy to drink and theres nothing bad about it.

My Bottom Line:
Cloves and bananas float atop this Weizenbocks caramelized cereals for a softly carbonated and lean example of the style.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam skirts the hazy dark amber.
-Carbonation could definitely be more effervescent.
-The flavor profile is not as complex as the best Weizenbocks out there.
-My expectations may have been too high for this brew as I usually love everything Great Lakes brews.

Bottle.

Bottle ( 12oz ).  Clear deep copper with an average frothy diminishing off-white head.  Aroma is mostly alcohol, mild spice and vague fruit (raisin?) - slightly nutty.  I quite like the taste - the alcohol is somewhat muted, and its fruity and spicy, dry roast, a bit floral.  Light body and carbonation, with a smooth not-boozy finish, just a dry spicy afterlinger.  Pretty drinkable.

12 oz. bottle via trade with Ughsmash - Pours a deep amber color with a one and a half finger thick off white head.  Aroma is esters (banana) and toasted malt.  Flavor is sweet esters and malt.  A tad dry.  Light to medium body.  Nice.  Thanks Jason.

12oz. Bottle:  Aroma of banana, slight wheat, and slight spices.  Poured orange/deep amber/light copper in color with a large, creamy, dense, beige head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Slightly sparkling.  Full of tiny, small, medium, and large-sized particles throughout.  Flavor is light to medium sweet.  Tastes of banana, light spices, slight wheat, light yeast, cloves, and light toasted caramel.  Medium body.  Lightly thick, slightly sticky texture.  Soft to average carbonation.  Light to medium sweet, banana, slight clove, and slight toasted malt finish is slightly dry, light yeast, and slightly sticky.  8%ABV is completely hidden.

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a ruby chestnut color with a medium sized khaki head that lingered. The aroma was malty, sweetish and had notes of banana bread, citrus and clove. The flavor was spicy and moderately sweet with notes of citrus, clove, banana and red wine. The finish was medium length and the body was thick and full.  Well done.

(Bottle, Monks Café, Wallingatan, Stockholm) Deep amber colour with huge, frothy, beige head. Clear. Fruity, malty, slightly toasty nose with notes of orange, caramel, chocolate and lots of red berries. Rather toned down wheat character. Fruity, malty taste with chocolate, raisins and along come the characteristic wheat flavours with banana and clove. Fairly sweet and more than full bodied. A bit different, but tasty and nice.
Bottled. Murky brown pour, fizzy head. Aroma of pinenuts, lemon, tar, wheat, bazooka joe bubblegum. Lively mouthfeel, grassy body, quite thick and yeasty, almost fleshy, with an oily, walnut finish.

4-pack of bottles, one of which poured flat. Drink by 11/11. Pretty red/amber pour (not the color in the current RB pic), decent head. Banana aroma. Taste is actually lighter than I was expecting, perhaps a bit watery. Cocoa, plum, banana and a hint of anise. The 8% isnt detectable.

Iced tea pour with a swirling sediment spellbinding appearance. Sweet, clean  and strong on the olfactory. Oh my, a strong pikantus impact. Big wheat bock fer sure. Wew, wheat beer kick. Difficult and alkoholic at times. Some creamy carbonation but the finish is really just plain large get you dizzy!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12oz bottle into a Weizen glass.

Appearance: The body has a deep old copper/amber color. It is very hazy and it produces a small creamy, light tan colored head on top. The head slowly fades down to a thin ring of foam that makes a little slice lacing on the glass.

Smell: Its aroma has big full nose of fruity and bready yeast with notes of banana, clove, toffee and fruited liquor.

Taste/Palate: To start with this beer has a nice mellow warmth throughout from its 8%abv. It has a big fruity yeast character and full bready malt with plenty of sweetness up front. It has notes of ripe banana, golden raison, sour cherry and just a hint of toffee, clove and leafy hops. The hops add some light bitterness to the back end. The finish is bone dry and the palate is very smooth with a solid medium to full body.

Notes: This was a very enjoyable Weizenbock. Its alcohol was very noticeable at first but mellows as you drink and as it warms.

A - Deep reddish orange in color. Tan head falls to blanket coating. No lacing.

S -Sweet malt, bananas, candied sugar, wheat.

T -Sweet malt, some toffee, mild banana, spice. It has an alcohol bite on end.

M/F -Active carbonation - a bit on the course side. Medium body.

D - Certainly not a bad beer but its no Vitus.

Bottle thanks to bman1113vr. Hazy ruby orange pour with a quickly receding beige head. Aroma is caramel, pancakes, maple, toffee, esters and alcohol on the nose. Flavor is esters, toffee, maple. The nose is a good bit better than the taste to be honest.

Bottle thanks to Jsquire. Pours with an aptly described, hazy plum colored body (not like the one pictured), with a fading off-white head. Aroma is strongly alcoholic for 8% ABV, and is backed with banana, toffee, cotton candy, sweetness, vanilla and wheat notes. Lower residual sugars than I was expecting, with bananas and buckwheat pancake batter. Falls a bit flat on the taste compared to the awesome aroma. Bubbly, lively and creamy carbonation.
Bottle Pours out a golden amber topped with a tan head. Aroma was of belg yeast, spice, banana, and rich malts. Taste was more of the spice, some nutmeg and candy sweetness.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2010 From trip to Westlake, Ohio.

Sweet, alcohol smelling nose.  Appearance is very nice brown color.  Flavor is semi-sweet, complex.  Palata: Smooth, a little fizzy.  Not a bad beer, interesting taste.  Great Lakes beers are pretty solid.

Rich reddish color with a smallish white head.  Aroma is full of banana, cloves, yeast, honey and some english toffee.  Flavor has lots of banana, clove, toffee, yeast and some fruit esters.  Nice beer.

Bottle.  Pour is cloudy dark copper (notably darker than the above picture) with a medium off-white head.  Aroma is rich toffee malt, maple syrup, spicy cinnamon and clove, banana, figs, and light black pepper.  Flavor is strong banana and spice up front with a light background sweetness.  Finish is crisp and peppery with a light lingering grassy flavor.  Very tasty.
Pours deep mahogany with a small beige head. Malt and alcohol aroma. Flavor is much better, bananas and cloves, with some yeast and malt. Medium body, somewhat light carbonation. Pretty good beer.

From a 12 oz bottle into a pint glass.  Pours with lots of foamy head which dissipates fairly quickly leaving only a thin layer.  Color is a great copper red, almost cherry-like.  Aroma is yeasty with plum, almost belgian like.  Taste is of yeast plums, cherry, clove and alcohol.  Its a bit too alcoholey for me which I normally dont like and in this case, causes the beer to have a mediciney taste.  Mouthfeel is very good, not too thick and not too thin.  Im not a huge fan of this style but I had to try any brew that GLBC makes.  Its a quality beer, but just not for me.

120z bottle from goryshkewych. Rating #165. Great looking beer, dark amber, burnt caramel color. Aroma had lots of toastiness, caramel maltiness, smelled great. Flavor was a little fruity, apples, not what I wexpected, way off from the aroma. ꀚ)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle hazy amber pour with hints of clove, banana and bread. Same in the taste with a tad bit of spice in the finish. Really good.

Bottle courtesy of Ughsmash, thanks man.   Pours a hazed tawny brown with a medium to large beige white head that diminishes rather quickly.  Big sweet plum and light banana notes and some light esters.   Medium bodied, lightly sweet, light plum and prune.  Finishes up with some light banana and yeast and a touch of alcohol.
Poured a nice hazy amber color with a small white head. Sweet fruity aroma and tasted of banana, cloves and some honey? Creamy palate. An excellent beer.

Sweet aroma, very small off-white head.  Nice red copper color to this beer.  Complex flavor; dominated by sweetness that turns into banana.  Smooth crisp finish with no alcohol burn which is good and surprising for a high-ABV beer.  Good.

I didnt think that I liked this style very much. But I liked this beer a lot. Nose is heavy bananas with some spice. Refreshing and light on the mouthfeel, with a crisp finish.  Definitely one to try, and as a former Clevelander, something that makes me proud.

Location: 12 oz bottle that jcos brought back from Cleveland, 9/11/09


Aroma: Sweet nose of yeast, berries, and nuts

Appearance: Pours a clear reddish-amber color

Flavor: Nice complexity, some sweet fruit, yeast, spice

Palate: Nice medium-full body, no alcohol burn. smooth

Overall Impression:
This is a pretty nice beer, it really works nicely, and can see why it is so highly rated, quite tasty and enjoyable.  A rich, flavorful beer with a nice complexity of flavor.  I could see going even higher on this score after a few more samplings, but Ill rate it here for now.  This is a pretty interesting beer.  
Drinking this one while watching MJs HOF speech, raise a glass to the GOAT!
Raspberry nectar color with small head and little carbonation.  Banana nut bread aroma.  Pleasantly slow lacing.  Banana, and honey appear early in taste, followed by mild bitterness.

bottle 355 ml 
Appearance:  copper amber ruby with slight haze and mid lighter rocky fizzy top.Nose:    solid aroma. Sweet peanut feel with paired wheat  , yeast ,fruit (berry with cherry) and caramel. Dry alcohol fnishing.7+Flavor/Palate :  Mid full bodied. Malty , slightly nutty hints with some of fruity tartness. Neatly composed together. Drinkable with alcohol dryness and warmth.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2009 Dark copper pour.  aroma is of caramel malts, plums, yeast, banana, and some other spices. Flavor is very sweet with many of the rich flavors from the aroma.  Very drinkable.  I liked this a lot.

Bottle - Deep amber pour with nary a head. Smells of smooth clove thats not overbearing, bubble gum, banana, and a bit of alcohol burn. Sweet and a bit syrupy, with just a bit of spice, grapes, a bit of toffee, and a nice warm, boozy finish. Smooth and a bit syrupy...very nice. Its not exactly sessionable, but I could drink several of these in a sitting.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2014 Sampled twice, first a bottle then years later, on tap at the brewpub.  Excellent both times and just like I remembered it when I came back to it. Fruity, estery aroma with suggestions of banana and spice, true to the commercial description.  Very smooth.  Light, given the high alcohol content, and the alcohol is well-masked in the aroma and flavor.  I am very impressed; this style of beer is easy to screw up, and its not even a style I am very fond of...and as usual, Great Lakes did an outstanding job at brewing a style that I dont really like in a way that I absolutely love!  So, A+++.  Heck yeah!

12 oz. bottle, consumed on 8-30-09. Yeasty, sweet aroma features candy, caramel, toffee, skittles, and light brownies scents as well as touches of bubblegum and citrus, especially orange. Clean, delicious, highly appetizing aroma. Pours a mostly clear (though with a bit of haze), bright copper with a brass hue. Highly effervescent with many bubbles. Moderate amount of even, creamy, taupe head. Nice, if short-lasting, lacing. Sweet yet sharp, surprisingly boozy taste. Pitted fruit, blood orange, and paprika flavors. Salty and spicy. Long, dry finish. Medium body. Wet. Sharp and lively in the palate. Very drinkable. Great Lakes Glockenspiel is a damn fine brew!

Bottled at Monks Café Wallingatan, Stockholm.  Hazy copper colour, brief head. Banana aroma with light toastiness. Sweet and fruity, medium bodied with fairly clean mouthfeel. Pleasant banana esters, but the clean moutfheel doesnt allow for muchdpth in flavour

Bottled at Monks Café Wallingatan, Stockholm. pours out in a hazy reddish amber colour with a small off-white head. Rich aroma of yeast, banana, almonds, nuts, red berries and alcohol. Nearly full-bodied with notes of over-riped banana, burnt caramel, raspberries, caramel, anise and alcohol. Rather clean mouthfeel. Warming finish of yeast, caramel, cloves pepper and alcohol.

Bottle. Bright amber color with a lace, fine head. Clear. Very original looking. Fruity, caramel aroma, with wheat malt and spices. Very fruity flavor, with cherries predominating, wheat malt, light banana. Slight sourness, and a bit of bitterness at the finish. Rich and tasty. Not like any weizenbock Ive had before-original and interesting, though missing much of the rich, soft, wheat maltiness.

Purchased at Woodmans in Madison, WI.  Nice aroma of banana, dark fruit, cinnamon, and vanilla.  Quite enjoyable.  Good malt heavy beer.  Slightly under the top in the style, but this still deserves mention as a very good weizenbock.

Bottle. Pours a clear amber-red with a small bubbly off-white head. Light, sweet aroma, of malt, dark fruits, grass. Sweet taste, of malt, candied fruits, sugar, citrus, and wood. Lingering sweetness. Tasty.

This one poured a lighter red/amber color with a white head. Aroma was light fruits, some toffee and sweet malts. Flavor was darker fruits, very sweet, but not really complex and alcohol comes through a bit as well.
bottled. clear light cooper  yeasty nose w/ bubblegum, banana, & spice.  Malty w/ obvious alcohol.

Bottle.  Aroma is rich fruity malt with clove notes and a mild spiciness.  Green apple tartness.  Perfectly clear red hued amber with a thin whispy off-white head that leaves no lasting lacing.  Flavor is full and rich with sweet malt evident and faint clove character.  Finishes with a hint of drness and a touch spicy.  A bit oil in the mouth, pleasant lingering dryness.

Bottle from Archer Liquors. Pours a very reddish amber with a large, bubbly beige/tan head. Lots of cooked stone fruit in the aroma. Medium body with frothy carbonation. Flavor has dark fruits and banana. Mixed spice notes. Really quite pleasant. Seems mild after Oat Goop, but its very flavorful. Finishes a bit malty, but the banana and spice persist. Good stuff. Seems like it would be good for breakfast.
Nice banana and wheat notes with sweet malts and refreshing fruits.  Dark fruits mix with the syrupy sweetness making it quite a meal of a beer.  Solid.

beautiful cherry red coloring with no head, nose is alcohol, wheat wine flavors, sweet and syrupy yet finishing dry, some mild wheaty tartness, a bit much in terms of alcohol presence in the flavor, but a very enjoyable ale just the same, tastes more like a barley wine than other weizenbocks ive had

A weizenbock shouldnt be this NOT cloudy.I mean, its a bit hazed, but a weizenbock should have some swampy wheat remenance, no? ...and this does not!  Then again, we dont rate by style here, and, thus...I guess I cant rate by style, even when rating appearance, which makes no sense since appearance is 100% dependant on style.  That being said, if styles didnt exist, id say it still looked inviting, slightly hazed gemstone shiney amber, a halo of light tan, then a very small tropical island of bubbles in the middle.  The nose was wheaty I guess but weizenbock thickness and meatiness level, fuck no.  Sublte oats and orange peel is what I get.  Clean, softly wheaty...a touch of softly grilled orange...and drinkable..a weizenbock? I dont really see it, but thanks for pretending...I guess I cant really think of what else id call it, but I prefer my weizenboccks a bit chunkier.

Bottled (thank you for finally bottling this!).  Poured hazy reddish-orange with a fine cap of off-white head.. just lovely.  The aroma picked up darker fruits, toasty bananas, and a pinch of honey with accents spicy wheat and cloves.. sticky-sweet, warm overall impression.  The flavor used the alcohol warmth to amplify peppery and clovey character.. plums, caramel, and bready support at the core.. sweet, fruity finish with a spicy kick.  Medium-bodied with ideal moderate-plus carbonation on the palate.. balance and mouthfeel were spot-on.  This should score a lot higher, and I plan on drinking many more.  Yum.
Very nice beer.  Went very well with the Chinese I had for dinner.  Aromas and flavors of ripe bananas.  A little sweetness is present.  The finish lingers for a long time.

A deep brown, amber pour with a creamy, off-white, thick head. Aroma has a strong clove presence, light banana, cinnamon all atop a bready note. Flavor starts off with a strong banana presence, cloves come in for a very quick appearance but then fades to a light nutty banana bread flavor ending with a slightly strong grain alcohol note. Mouth feel is good and carbonation is on par to the style. Overall a decent beer but the alcohol in my opinion is just a tad bit too much and overpowers the other flavors.

Draft.  Nice looking pour, cloudy amber orange with a small white head.  Banana, clove, and Belgian yeast are the primary components of the nose and flavor.  A little bread and wheat to fill it out.  Full bodied, smooth, crisp, and well-balanced.  Alcohol is mostly hidden but shows up a pinch on the palate.  Excellent seasonal from an excellent brewer, Ill be waiting for this one to come back around.

I bought a 6-pack of the GLBC Grassroots Ale when it came out, and that was a mistake.  Id have preferred if Id bought a six of this...much better.  When I think Weizenbock, and I think of the Schneider & Brooklyner Hopfen-Weisse as the form of the style.  And this looks, smells, and tastes enough like Schneider Weisse that I got the idea right away.  Pretty good - and in a style I find to be pretty uncommon but pretty tasty.  This beer pours orange with a ton of head.  Aroma is spice and malt.  Flavor is sweet, malty, and again, spicy with clove.  Mouthfeel is split - there is a full malty component, and a watery note.  Strange that mouthfeel is split into two different textures.

This beer didnt knock my socks off - but solid.  Id recommend.

I went all the way to WI and bought this beer and brought it all the way back to OH where I live.  What a waste!

Love the color, love the flavor. Banana and clove run through this beer. Light fruits and yeast ever present in the nose and front end of the taste. Crisp and clean and decently complex. Palate slightly lacking for the style but a good effort from Great Lakes. Hoping this sticks in the seasonal rotation in the future.

Enjoyed from a 12oz bottle in a pub glass.  The bee pours a medium to deep amber color, with a short-lived white head.  The nose brings the characteristic "Wiezen" notes of some clove, and a touch of tropical fruit.  Also evident is some malt and a bit of alcohol.  The mouthfeel is pretty full across the palate, and flavors of yeast-derived esters, along with some pilsner malt come through.  The presence of alcohol, along with a fairly high note of carbonation combine to make the finish of the palate a bit harsh.  Overall, a nicely crafted beer.

Bottle from coyotehunter.   Thanks matt.  Plum pinkish red with a small off white lace.  Nose of banana, honey, clove, alcohol.  Nice clean flavor; not dominated by one characteristic too much.  Good weizenbock.

Appearance:  Pours amber with almost no head whatsoever.

Aroma:  Fruity yeast, clove,candi sugar,perfume and flowers.

Taste:  Caramel,burnt sugar,banana,clove, and peppery hops.

Mouthfeel:  Thick and full.

Overall:  A great beer. I think it needs a head on it, but thats getting nit picky.

Thanks turd for sharing. Pours a reddish copper orange with a light haze. One finger creamy yellow head. The nose shows banana/isoamyl acetate, sweet, spicy, weizen yeast, bready with some alcohol. Flavor shows clove, spicy, yeasty, bready, banana, mild sour wheat flavor. The palate shows spicy alcohol and a round smooth mouthfeel.

Pours a dark copper with a medium sized off white head that completely fizzed away in seconds. Smells like Granny Smith apples and bananas, some nutty malt, and a little dark fruit. Flavor is similar, and changes in the same order. Sweet and a little bit tart. Watery palate. Although it is before the expiration date, I cant help but feel this is past its prime. Ill have to re-rate eventually.

Deep copper pour with ruby highlights and a small off-white head.  Some nice plum and fig notes punctuated by spicy, peppery Noble hops with hints of banana and clove.  Theres also a bit of vegetalness there too.  Theres a somewhat irony vegetal quality throughout that detracts from the soft dark fruit flavors.  The flavor also has notes of ripe banana, spicy hops, pepper and clove.  The body is creamy but a little thin for a weizenbock and heavily carbonated.  Pretty decent stuff but by no means is this on par with Aventinus.

Bottle.  Clear dark pumpkin colored pour, minimal carbonation and a nice aroma of spicy/sweet banana.  Flavor was thick and sweet banana, pepper and plenty of mellow fruit on the finish.  Alcohol was very well hidden for being 8%.  Great lakes hits another homer on this one.

Copper color with a moderate, fairly fizzy vanilla folder colored head. Swells like a heavy weiss, with bananas, sweet wheat, malt-o-meal, bubble gum; just a rather heavy weiss scent. In some ways right and in a few others a bit too sweet. Fairly heavy, and nearly too "dead" a feel. I still like some zip in my weizenbock. Fruity and malty start, with marzipan and bananas. Middle has a bit of vanilla. A nice progression on tastes. A bit of lightly roasted nuts in the finish. I am reminded of beernuts.

Bottle.  That picture cant be this beer ... mine is reddish orange with a monster foam top.  Classic weizenbock character all the way ... stark banana-clove aroma, nice esthery flavor, sweet and yeasty.  Yummy yummy in my tummy.  (#3626, 8/2/2009)

Ill preface this with my general disfavor for wheat beers.  This beer pours copper, with some sediment trailing.  Virtually no head.  Astringent wheat aroma, with coriander and cloves coming out.  Sweet and wheaty.   The alcohol covers some of the wheat bite.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: 12oz - Lovely toffee colored liquid under tan head.  Sweet, malty nose.  A little too sweet on first sip, but that fades.  Enough of the Bock type wood notes to be true to the style, but far from overpowering.  I liked it.

Tastes like banana bread - butter, banana, brown sugar, sweet spice - but the beer itself isnt too sweet. Smells like baked goods at first, then more like beer. Thickish, but not fizzy. Pretty - especially at first with tight head (it goes away).

Pours a nice reddish copper color with a finger high tan head that quickly settles into more beer. The head clings to the glass like...like...well, it clings well. Smells like faint bananas, not much else. Great flavor of bananas and clove...how did I know.Some spice from the clove, almost syrupy in the mouth, and it seems to stick to the throat and hold on for dear life. THAT....I could do without. Light alcohol burn in the finish, decent beer.

Its about time the experts at Great Lakes produced a Weizenbock and they didnt disappoint!  Perfect aroma and spicy, banana taste with a well hidden alcohol note.   You will like this beer.
Its a bit expensive, though.

Spicy clove and banana on the nose, with caramel malts, and hints of honey.  Pours a light amber with a thin white head.  Bready citrusy flavor with some banana and spicy clove with a light caramel, very nice weizen bock!!!

12oz from goryshkewych.  Pour opaque amber- caramel color with a white head.  Nose is bread, brown sugar, spice, and banana.  Flavor is brown sugar and banana up front with bread, caramel, and fizz in the rear.  Medium-bodied and enjoyable sweet weizen bock.  Nice wheat flavor present in addition to the sugary bock ness.  #950.
Pour is a clear amber with a small quickly dissipating head. Very prominent banana with a mild spicy finish. Not much going on but not bad by any means
@Pauls Girardin chugging-12oz bottlepours a light tan ring for a head and hazy amber color.  Aroma is sweet medium malt-caramel, banana. Taste is sweet medium malt-caramel/peat, banana, spice hops.

12 oz bottle from DrBayern (thanks Matt!!), Pours a cloudy, cool looking, dark orange/red with a tiny little white head. Smells of mild banana, clove, some sweet tart fruits, wheat, cinnamon and malts. The flavour is slightly tart, mildly carbonated, with a profound wheat presence. Seemingly more weizen than bock.   Dry wheat malt tastes finish w/ a clove and toasted malt and raisiny clove spiced short lived aftertaste. Leaves the palate clean begging for more! Well made and enjoyable beer, much Mahalo Matty!
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle.  I was certainly not expecting this.  Wow...what an offering from GL!  Not typically one of my favotie styles but I believe Ive been converted.  Big Hefe characteristics, smoked with a full body.  Lightly carbonated with a smooth finish.  A great beer.

7/14/2009:  Im glad to see that Great Lakes finally put Glockenspiel Weizenbock into bottles so that I can try it...  The beer pours a hazy copper to amberish color with a beige crown that bubbles away pretty quickly.  The aroma has caramelized sugar and some banana.  The flavor has banana, light spice, a yeasty middle, and the alcohol is hidden.  This beer has a medium to meidum-full body and is chewy.  Overall this beer is a big hefe and very good.  Summary:  This beer tastes like banana dipped in caramel with ground clove sprinkled on top!
12 fl. oz. bottle (8.0% Alc/Vol) at Courtside Pizza & Sports Bar in Athens, Ohio during Ohio Brew Week 2009.  Rating #113 for this beer.

Compliments of the Good Drbayern.  This is N-I-C-E!!!  Though the aroma is minimal, it poured a dark amber with a hint of red.  The head was nice, light and lacy.  A wonderfully smooth malt flavor with a hint of spice. The mouthfeel is smooth like velvet.  A Full Bodied easy drinking, uptown beer!  A new favorite!

This happens to be one of my favorite styles, I mean add wheat to bock and you are bringing together two very good worlds.  This one starts out nice with a hazy reddish orange color, minimal head, apple cider aroma + bananas and baked bread, wow.  Nice sour palate, coloves and bananas, thick, dense, earthy, some plums in the back, and something big and earthy at the end I couldnt put my fingers on.  Very nice representative of the German style.

Bottle: Hazy copper with a dense off white film of head. Relatively sweet aroma with a solid malt presence meshing with esters making if reminiscent of caramel soaked banana- has some clove phenols as well. Creamy dense carbonation. Softly sweet undertones in the flavor with notes of plum, vanilla, but stays balanced by some spicy clove phenolics. A solid Weizenbock.

12oz bottle (Enjoy by 11/09/09) served in a weizen glass.  Attractive, clear, dark copper pour with a thick head of light beige foam that slowly faded into a lasting cap.  Slick, spotty lacing.  The aroma had strong notes of yeasty banana and clove.  Also some caramelized malt and fresh wheat bread.  The flavor had fruity banana balanced out by rich caramel and a bit of spicy clove.  The big malty notes steal the show, but the banana and clove add some nice depth.  Full-bodied with light carbonation.  Big and malty, but really drinkable and tasty.

Bottle from 3 Sons.
Copper color, sweet, and a hit of Belgian in this Wheatbock.  You can taste the cloves at finish.  as usual a nice example of style with its own unique twist from GL

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2009 12 oz bottle courtesy of Binnys (Orland Park, IL). Pours a hazy dark amber, small offwhite head that films, laces some. Aromas are banana and clove off the bat, flaked wheat and softer esters, a hoppy floral feel works in as well. Pleasant. Initial is a bit darker and toasted on the malts, bringing banana esters and cloves into the body for a pleasant combination. Grainy wheat, smooth and a firm yet lighter body than expected wth light spiciness. Bringing up light bitterness, largely a smooth body, fruity and malts, very pleasant and fuller. Finish is light bitter and a bit darker malt. Not bad at all.

Pours a pale clear amber with a full orangish, off-white head.  Aroma of citrus and caramel.  Smooth sweet roasted malt flavor, buttery and yeasty, some citrus and licorice.  Alcohol not noticeable.  Very good.

12oz dalekliz brought back for me from Ohio.  Pours reddish orange with a tan head.  Nose is sweet and quite heavily full of cloves.  Taste has less cloves, but they are there with a good punch of bananas.  Overall pretty good.  Thanks Liz.
Bottle pours hazy dark amber color with off white head. Aroma is strong banana and clove with some yeast. Medium mouth feel. Flavor follows the nose and has some dark fruit mixed in. Good stuff.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange copper with a beige head. Spicy aroma, with ripe banana, clove, and bubblegum. The flavor has a nice balance of fruity banana and clove, with a light toasty and wheaty presence. Nice.

Body is rich copper, almost ruby.  Thin off-white head.  Nose is banana, clove, brown sugar, plastic, some caramel & rich honey.  Flavor is rich malt, clove, banana, more of that plastic (alcohol?), plums, raisins, dark fruits - almost dried figs.  Hops come out in the finish.  Nice enough but a bit sweet & lacking depth.

Bottle. Deep amber body with a big, but diminishing, off-white head. Spicy/fruit aroma of banana, clove, biscuit, wheat and caramel. Hints of orange, alcohol. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes the same. Tastes of sweet banana, overripe fruit. Slight lingering taste of alcohol and nail polish that drags this down a little. Medium body with a very smooth texture. Lively carbonation. Nice balance and complexity.
Lovely beer on a hot day, found at Premiere Gourmet.  Pours peachy golden with a white head. Pleasant bananna aroma.  Taste is Orange, wheat with some spice. Most fresh and drinkable.

Bottle from Party Source.

Poured an clear brown color with an average creamy off-white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy tart citrus, banana and clove and alcohol aroma. Medium body with a smooth sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate duration.

Solid drinkable beer.

Bottle, has a slight hazy red-ruby pour with an off-white one finger head that thins to a cover, the glass is full of effervescence, aromas of dark fruit (Plum and Raisin) with spice (Clove and others from phenols), bread, the flavor mimics the aromas, and gives a little pepper prickling on the palate, alcohol appears a bit as the beer warms, an ok drink.

12 oz. bottle. Clear, deep amber and a creamy, but small, yellow/tan head settling to a fine ring. Banana and clove as expected, but there is some additional fruitiness, peach and apricot. Additional aromas of caramel and toffee round out the profile. Medium body, lively carbonation, crreamy mouthfeel, slowly drying palate. Malty sweetness up front, spicy bitterness starts coming through at mid palate. This holds up well against the better examples of the style. Smooth, easily drinkable, complexity that demands attention.
Pours amber and lightly hazy with a mostly receding off-white head. Notes of spice (clove, nutmeg) plum, toffee, and bubble gum. Medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation. Very nice.

I was pleasantly surprised with how good this beer was.  Weizen Bock is not a style that I know much about, but this beer was good.  The color was deep amber with a nice tan head that hung around a bit and the aroma was that of nutmeg.  The flavors were big malt and spice with a nice hop presence throughout.  I despise overly sweet, malty beers, but this beer was fresh, big in body and complex.

Sample at AleFest Columbus (06/27/09): The beer pours a cloudy copper-orange color with a medium and fluffy white head that diminishes slowly. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of bananas and cloves. Medium, clean body with flavors of yeast, bananas and clove. Light hops presence in the background all along. The finish is fruity with a spiced aftertaste. Overall there are other beers I wish they would have bottled before this one (*ahem* Monster) but its not a bad Weizen Bock.

12 oz. bottle poured to a shaker as a hazy, deep orangy/amber with a light tan "diminishing to film" head, a foaming ring and spotty lacing. The aroma was bready, sweetness, ripe banana, some mid- tone fruit, and light spice notes. The flavor followed as the aroma notes with a lively carbonation and medium+ body. Quality representative of the style. Almost as good as Rodneys.

Bottles from goryshkewych. Thanks man! This one has aromas of banana, clove, toasted wheat bread, some fruit - apples?, and a touch of alcohol. Pours slightly hazy plum color - according to description - with a decent head. Sweet flavors of banana, spicy yeast, fruity notes, toasted wheat, caramel, and a little crisp/tartness in the finish. A hint of warming alcohol makes its presence felt as well.

Bottle (2009) in a weizen; slightly hazy orange (although not as dark, or hazy as one would expect from this style) w/ a relatively modest beige head; aroma is slightly sweet and heavy in bananas, yeasty tones and slightly understated cloves; flavor is very-well balanced w/ all the characteristic wheat beer flavors (albeit with toned down cloves) and caramel; medium bodied and super refreshing. Slightly more tart than would would expect, which I liked. As with most Great Lakes stuff, very tasty. Good stuff boys.

12oz bottle from matt/devon (actually gerritt!) methinks.  thanks buds.... pours a dark reddish caramel brown with a quickly dissipating thin white head..... assertive aroma of banana, dark fruit, and caramel esthers....flavors follow suit.with a pretty pronounced sweetness.  smooth, sweet profile overall that is quite nice for the style.

Bottle from the Orland Park, IL, Binnys Beverage Depot:  This poured a caramel colored body with a short-lived beige head and had some slippery lacework.  The aroma was warm whole wheat bread with caramel and some overly ripe bananas.  The flavor added some light brown spices and a touch of alcohol.  Nice.

Bottle. Translucent straw/orange-brown body, puffy buff head. The spicy, sweet nose with clove, bubblegum, and light banana esters reminds me of circus peanuts or candy corn. The body, too, reminds me of these candies, with bubblegum, clove, and hints of banana in addition to caramel and vinous alcohol notes. The complexity rivals Belgian ales of similar ABV. This is an excellent wheat beer, a fine addition to Great Lakes bottled lineup.

12 oz bottle from Archer Liquors.  Cloudy and brown with a decent size beige head. Aroma is very sweet with some caramel, banana, spices and sweet, yet powerful bready malts. Taste is a full-bodied mix of bready-wheat malts, sweet bananas, dried cherries. Smooth finish. Impressive.

reddish brown with mild white head with low carbonation.  nose mostly of banana yeasty notes.  some hop bitterness with clove esters being dominant.  some alcohol and maybe oxidation come through next and some unfermented sugars.  a solid, bet unspectacular brew, mildly disappointed

On tap at the Great Lakes dinner at the Bethel Rd Winking Lizard on 6/11/09.  Opaque amber pour with a big white head.  Aroma is a bushel of bananas (can bananas be measured in bushels?) with caramel and sweet malts and some spice.  Caramel flavor up front with a hint of whiskey, lots of banana and just a smidge of hop dryness.  Sweet finish with clove and some other spices.  Not my favorite style, but I can tell its well-made.

Bottle thanks to 17floor.  Dark ruby copper color with small to medium, creamy beige head.  Aroma is wheat and yeast with banana, dryer alc and some caramel.  Flavor is sweet plum nd other dark fruit, grain, banana, vanilla, alc, spices, crisp finish.  Medium body and creamy with pretty active carbontion.  I feel like a its a pretty pungent version of the style but very tasty.
pours amber with a small offwhite head.  notes of banana, spices, and raison.  Sweet, but not overaly sweet.  pretty well balanced.

12oz bottle. Pours a deep amber red with a thin head of tight creamy bubbles. Aroma is rich sweet and spice. The flavors are really well blended and complex. Sweetness that borders on fruitiness and cloves and banana that add complexity and interest. Really a drinkable and interesting beer. Fantastic for the style.

Great Lakes Glockenspiel is a dim, hazy, reddish brown ale with a yellowish off-white head that leaves nice lacing.  It has a sweet, spicy, estry aroma with notes of banana, clove, raisin, fig, apple, coriander and black pepper.  Its full bodied and syrupy with a sticky finish.  It seems a touch scratchy.  Its quite sweet with all of the aroma elements present in the flavor.  Its a little resiny, leathery and phenolic, with an alcoholic aftertaste.  Its pretty good, but I couldnt see reaching for a second one.

Intense Weizen Bock, Im glad to see Great Lakes bottle this grand wheat.  The aroma is a friendly assault of banana, brown sugar and tons of clove.  The scent permeates the air.  Brownish copper color with an amber tint.  Off white head that lasts for the duration and solid lacing around the glass.  Medium bodied and exceptionally smooth with a creamy, boozy sweetness.  Dry, crisp wheat and some biscuit malt flavor.  Plenty of banana and clove with notes of raisin, pear and perhaps a touch of pumpkin.  This beer is a great dark, strong wheat with plenty of character.

Source:  12 oz bottle purchased at Andersons in Toledo. Glass: Poured into a tall stem glass. Appearance: Poured a hazy orange/brown color with a thin beige head.  Aroma:  Heavy with clove, with a hint of bananas and wheat. Flavor: Nuts and caramel malt with a huge clove presence and a hoppy finish. Palate:  Medium body with solid carbonation.Overall:  Excellent representation of the style.  Love this style, and was elated to try this beer.

Quite drinkable for 8%. Spicy but well integrated with the chewy, woody, slightly smoky, deeply bready malt. Good, and worth the wait for this in bottles. Aroma is strongly spiced (nutmeg and cinnamon, wet turned earth).
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Oh my goodness the cloves.  If anyone rates this low, they had a bad batch, because I had a fresh batch that was phenomenal.  This had lots of cloves, some pumpkin, some banana *but light on it* and some heavy nutiness.. walnut and almond and brazilnuts oh my!  it was fantastic, well-rounded, a little american-hoppy, and plenty of flavor!!!

12oz bottle. Pours copper with almost no head. Aroma is very medicinal with lots of alcohol, malt, caramel, and brown sugar. Taste is very malty with lots of caramel and a nice brown sugar taste. Underneath the heavy malt taste, there is lots of spice, banana, and yeast. Has a very bready overall taste. At first, the alcohol is very harsh and it takes a few sips to get past it. Once the beer warms, it becomes a very pleasant drinking experience. It never quite shakes the medicinal taste though. Worth drinking.

Bottle.  Pretty good Weizen Bock, especially considering its a US brew.  I thought it looked great, with a orange-red color and large frothy white head.  Aroma gives off the strong smell of yeast, bread, some banana, and malts.  Flavor is similar, with a malty wheat taste followed by some banana and bread dough.  Too bad I just tried Aventinus for the first time a few days ago. This one doesnt quite compare, but seems true to be true to style.

12 oz bottle

A recent release from Great Lakes this one I sought out hoping it would erase memories of the disaster that was Grassroots.  Not only does it do that it is one of the best weizenbocks I have tried.  This is a style I need to seek out more often.

Aroma / Appearance - The opaque mahogany body and off white head sticks to the sides of the glass.  Caramel, black cherry, sourdough pretzels, and semi-sweet chocolate chips mix into a malty blend.

Flavor / Palate - Fluid and light bodied it sits easily on the tongue and throat.  Chocolate chip bread, cherry hard candy, and fruity notes make this is enjoyable to drink.  Despite being 8% it goes down easily.  A great value at around $10 this one will hopefully make it to your area soon.

(bottle - 12 oz) Hazy golden pour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet and spicy with nice hints of wheat, clove, yeast, and some banana. Flavor is very sweet but rather mild at the start. Good spice and sweet notes with hints of the cloves, some nutmeg, caramel, yeast, and a light nutty finish. Smooth and very refreshing. Cant taste the alcohol at all.
bottle via trade with goryshkewych, medium amber color with some lasting foam, good spicy banana aroma, flavors of cloves, nutmeg, fruity caramel, banana, nice medium lasting finish

Pours a hazy amber orange color with a nice tan head that leaves good lacing.  Aroma of banana and wheat with hops poking through, maybe some honey as well.  Taste is the same banana and wheat, other sweet malts with some hops.  This beer seems to ooze sweet medium bodied malts with a wonderful balance of spices to compliment.  Some carbonation but mostly smooth.  None of the usual finishing tinge I have found in a lot of Great Lakes beers.  Crisp finish.  Rivals Edmund Fitzgerald for my second favorite GL brew.

12 oz bottle.  Pours hazy reddish brown with a decent off white head. Smells of pale malts, wheat, and spices.  Tastes wheaty, malty, spicy, and sweet.  Flavors of some banana, clove, and ginger are prominant, while milder flavors yeast, caramel, dark fruit, and syrup follow up.  Nice lasting aftertaste and body.

(bottle from OSLO) Pours nothing like whats pictured on the left, and instead of a hazy yellow, its actually a dark reddish amber with a thin off-white head.  Aroma is potent and possesses all aspects of a weizenbock, with clove, tart wheat, banana, and even a hint of spearmint as well.  The taste starts out really rich with caramel, toffee, and banana, but this quickly switches to a bone dry finish of tart wheat, spice, and yeast.  When cold the finish is somewhat tinny, and is slightly reminiscent of canned salmon, but thankfully this tones down as it warms.  Mouthfeel is medium with lively carbonation.  Not a bad weizenbock.  Thanks Al!

Bottle courtesy of fiver29.  Pours a hazy amber with a 2 finger light tan head.  The nose is caramel, fruity bubblegum and wheat. The taste is spice, banana bread, fruit and a touch of booze.  Medium bodied.  Decent brew  thanks John!

Amber pour with nice white head.  First smell is of banana, but not overpowering.  Some clove aroma. 
Sweet flavor, slight banana, spiciness from the wheat.  Very smooth and flavorful.  Slight hint of the high alcohol.  Overall, wonderful weizen bock without too much banana.
Caramel malt, banana, clove, yeast nose, more of the same in flavor. Fruit and spice flavor, doughy yeast & slightly boozy but smooth finish.
Dark copper pour.  Lots of fruit and spice in the nose.  The flavor is lightly sweet with a bit of Bananas Foster to it.  Pretty good.

Pours an amber color with an off-white head.  Aroma is of caramel malts, plums, yeast, banana, and some cloves.  Flavor is pretty much the same with the banana and cloves coming out more on the flavor than the aroma.  Overall pretty decent.

bottle at Fort Wayne tasting - Pours hazy orange with a lasting head.  It has a rich aroma of malt and bananas.  This brew has a bubbly palate and tastes of sweet wheat malt with yes, bananas and cloves, along with some caramel and some other spices.  Nice brew.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2009 big juicy fruity aroma. plenty of banana. clove is very prounced in flavor, making things more spicy then just sweetly fruity.  strong bubble gum esthers as well. a bit boozy and upfront but not quite off putting.  this beer displays the trademark esters of any good weizen yeast strand. soft and silky mouthfeel, even when well chilled. wonderul appearance, dark nearly hazel with a touch of rust colored roundness.

The pour is cloudy and amber hued.  The head is a small ring of bubbles around the glass.  The aroma is strong and yeasty with some banana like hints.  The beer is well balanced between malts and hops, the malts are touch more dominate.  The character as a buttery/smooth feel.  The hints of banana come through was well as good deal of clove.  The beer has a touch too much carbonation.  Pretty good.  I had not had this offering from Great Lakes, so I was lucky I found a few loose in the local mega mart.

Odd time to release a weizen bock?  12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy glowing orange brown with a tightly packed white bubbly foamy head.  Nice weizenbock aroma, similar to Victory Moonglow, sweet and rich, caramel, clove and bananas.  Flavor is very sweet, rich, phenolic, metallic bananas, lots of peanuts, touch hot especially in the finish, syrupy aftertaste.  Medium/full bodied with sharp carbonation and a slightly syrupy feel.

Caramel with good, creamy tan head / Light nose of dark fruit and malt / Medium to full bodied, malty and modestly sweet, with very good balance and finish / Flavors of plums, apricots, banana, bread, toasted grain, cloves, and cinnamon / Another nice effort by GL, especially in restraining the cloying nature of so many of these.

Hazy, murky amber color with thin off white head. Aroma of banana and clove, with some notes of muffin,. Subtle fruity flavor, with some spice and yeast. Pretty nice beer. Creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied, good carbonation. Finish is a bit wattery, but it hides the alcohol well. Pretty nice beer.
Bottle pours hazy dark amber color with off white head.  Aroma is strong banana and clove with some yeast.  Medium mouthfeel.  Flavor follows the nose and has some dark fruit mixed in.  Nice.

Shared at tjthreshs house - Aroma is strong banana, doughy yeast, clove and a touch of cinnamon.  Pours dark brown with a small head and great lacing.  Flavor is yeasty and spicy but overpowered by banana.  Palate is creamy.  A tasty brew but a little too much nana to be enjoyable in large quantities.

Draft at the Brewpub.  Served in a pint glass, cold as hell.  Pours very cloudy, hazy, dull orange color with quite a large (for draft at least) white head that is persistent.  When I first smelled this I thought I got a blast of smoke aroma but it’s just the nose getting used to the intense phenols.  After a couple seconds it turns into intense clove and banana.  I hate to be so stereotypical saying clove and banana but it really does display those two things and they are very heavy, especially the banana.  Very ripe, fresh, dessert-like banana.  Taste is very phenolic with the same flavors coming through.  Spritzy on the tongue.  Very flavorful.  Hides its alcohol very well.  I don’t know how much I like Weizenbocks but this is certainly a very solid example of the style.

On tap at GLBC.  Body is a cloudy amber/gold/orange with a little bit of a head.  Cloves and sugar/bubble gum dominate the nose, and flavor is fairly consistent with this... In addition to the sweetness and cloves, honey/pear sweetness presents itself as does a nice banana aftertaste.  The 8% abv is hidden well.  Wish they bottled this stuff.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Growler from Cliff.  Pours a hazy amber with some brown hues.  Lots of banana in the nose with just a pinch of clove.  Doughy wheaty back bone as well.  Bunches of bananas and clove with maybe a pinch of cinnamon as well.  Full body with an above average amount of carbonation.  Dry and spicy finish.  Really damn good stuff.

On tap at great lakes brewery on 9/19/2008.  Very hazy yellow-orange color and a thin head.  Beautiful looking beer.  Aroma is a strong fruity spicy mix of yep, you guessed it, clove and banana.  I smelled the some fresh wheat and dark blueberries in there as well.  Flavor was top-notch.  Great viscous beer covered all the areas of the mouth with a rich fruity flavor with a hint of spice.  Definitely one of my favourites from Great Lakes.

GABF 2007. An unclear golden beer with a thin beige head. The aroma is sweet malty with a light note of rotten fruit - too much. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of over ripe fruits - almost rotten, as well as notes of alcohol and wood. Not to my liking.
An old rating i finally got to entering. Aroma was very banana and malty tasting. Flavor was realyl good and sweet with a light yeastiness.

Growler at cbus 9, shared by leopoldstoch!   Pours a copper color with a smallish off white head.   Aroma is caramel, brown sugar, dough.   Flavor are sweet caramel malts, dought, light banana, light floral.   Palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, finished sweet and lightly warming.   Awesome!!

Cbus9 shared by butters. Orange-red pourwith a white head. Aroma of lemon/lemon zest, brown sugar, yeast, and banana. Flavors of sweet malt, light clove, earthy hops, yeast, and banana. Medium body sweet with a dry finish.

On tap @ the brew pub 10/7/07:  Deep amber coppery, hazy, w/ a lasting light beige, medium sized head.  Wheat malt, toasted malt w/ a combination of raisiny and plum fruit, clove, and bananas all at once!  An ever so slight vanilla note w/ a touch of bubblegum!  Classic nose!  Well balanced but just to sweet malty flavors.  Wheat malt, bananas, cloves, toasted malt and hints of bubblegum and raisins.  Dry wheat malt flavored finish w/ a clove and toasted malt and raisiny clove spiced short lived aftertaste.  Leaves the palate clean begging for more!  I really prefer Aventinus, but this to me seems like a really good WB!  Lots of the classic flavors/aromas, and highly enjoyable!

Shared by butters at C-bus9.  I did not get this at all apparently, as I thought it was horrid.  The taste was buttery, messy and a convoluted mess of sweet malts, butter, bubble gum and so on.  Perhaps infected?  I dont see how as it was straight from the brewery, but this was just awful in my opinion.
GABF 2007:  Poured a hazy brown-yellow color.  The aroma had a hint of banana, wheaty citrus and some sweetness.  Wheaty flavor with a nice banana note.  Medium bodied.

GABF 2007.  Pours to a murky amber body with a thin white head.  The aroma is strange.  Seems to be boiled or fermented too hot.  Tons of phenols and some butterscotch.  The flavor is sweet with lots of phenolic compounds and a honeysuckle like sweetness.  Seems to be very artificial.  Sweet moderate palate.  Im let down.
